RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 64. Waiver Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $4,200 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FILLY FATALE broke sharply and cleared the field midway through the first turn to take a clear lead from along the inside into the backstretch, maintained her advantage while saving ground through the final turn, repelled a challenge from TEXAS LEGACY leaving the turn, and proved best. TEXAS LEGACY away alertly and stalked the early pacesetter while racing two wide entering the backstretch, launched his bid two out from the rail entering the final turn, but failed to sustain his bid in the drive while finishing four out from the rail late to get the place. MILO'S COMMAND tracked the leader into the backstretch while easing one off the rail, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and fought on gamely through the lane from along the rail to just miss the place. THERE GOES MY HERO stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, trailed the field into the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: There Goes My Hero
ENTRY.OWNER: Klimes Helen McDonald Jo-Anne and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, trailed, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Milo's Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Filly Fatale
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led inside, rallied rail, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 61. Waiver Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS THE HYPE away alertly and raced to the lead while saving ground at the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace while on an uncontested lead in the run down the backside, turned back the bid by DRILL BABY DRILL through the final turn, and drew clear in the lane to prove best. PERFECT PENNY stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished with late interest from along the rail in the drive. BEST ONE YET away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing from between rivals, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to grab a share. DRILL BABY DRILL broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, set sail after the leader two wide entering the final turn, but was all out late to hold the place while racing five wide in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss the Hype
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, held, best

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Best One Yet
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 75. Waiver Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $4,375 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 30 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Ea ch $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOOT SOLDIER broke sharply and tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while saving ground along the inside, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly four wide entering the lane, took command in deep stretch and quickly drew clear. I'M A CHI TOO away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the inside of DON W in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was no match when tackled by FOOT SOLDIER in mid stretch, but battled gamely to hold the place. DON W away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of I'M A CHI TOO, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, but was outfinished late while racing two out from the rail. MAKEITORBREAKIT stalked the contested early pace while racing just out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished with late interest from along the rail in the drive. BARNEY GOOGLE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, and failed to make a serious late factor. Following the running of this race there was a trainer's claim of foul. The trainer of DON W lodged a claim of foul against FOOT SOLDIER for alleged interference in mid stretch. after review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: I'm a Chi Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vie rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Don W
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Foot Soldier
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Barney Google
ENTRY.OWNER: Roberts-Henson Michelle Henson Brad Henson Randy Henson Dan and Irwin Trevor
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 66. Waiver Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $4,200 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 13 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Ra ce Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IRISH LUNA away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, gained a narrow advantage in mid stretch and just lasted. ANOTHERSUNNYDAY tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, launched her bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in the drive to just miss. ARIKARA broke sharply and dueled for the lead while racing to the outside of IRISH LUNA entering the backside, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival through the final turn and into the stretch, and gave way grudgingly late to just miss. PINEAPPLE TIDBITS stalked the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly four wide through the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive while gaining late. IMA DAREDEVIL away well and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing one out from the rail in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Luna
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Ima Daredevil
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked inside, rallied rail, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Pineapple Tidbits
ENTRY.OWNER: Musgrove Donald H Spencer Stewart and Johnson Lyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Arikara
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Anothersunnyday
ENTRY.OWNER: Leffler Bob Killins Bryan and McCormick Gord
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 75. Waiver Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 30 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MR. QUALITY broke sharply and eased off the dueling leaders to gain a tracking trip one out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly while being carried five wide in deep stretch to prove best. KNOPFLER away alertly and dueled for the lead one out from the rail entering the first turn, forced the issue in the run down the backside from the outside of RACING RIVER, took a narrow advantage into the lane, but was unable to fend off MR. QUALITY late in a game effort. JUVEE TOO settled off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from just off the rail through the final turn, tipped six wide entering the lane, and finished with late interest while racing in tight quarters in deep stretch. APPELLANT settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing three wide in the drive. RACING RIVER away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of KNOPFLER in the run down the backside, continued to battle from the inside of that rival through the final turn, but faded in the stretch drive. YOU DON'T OWN ME through his head in the opening strides to get away poorly, and trailed the field throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Juvee Too
ENTRY.OWNER: High Stakes Thoroughbreds and Snow John
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Racing River
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Appellant
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Knopfler
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Quality
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 w, rallied 3w, closed 5w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: through head start, trailed, showed little

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 20000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 30 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EDDIE WHO was bumped and steadied from along the inside in the run to the first turn, worked his way into a tracking trip one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, collared the pacesetter entering the final turn, and wore down that rival in deep stretch to prove best. STORMY BLUE broke sharply and rushed to the lead from along the rail to open a clear advantage entering the backstretch, battled from the inside of EDDIE WHO through the final turn, and gave way grudgingly in deep stretch while proving clearly second best. PRINCE CAIRO away alertly, but was taken in hand and allowed to trail the field into the backstretch, commenced his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive. EARS TO US was put in tight quarters and forced to steady approaching the first turn, raced into a stalking trip two out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked a finishing response when called upon. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul, the rider of EARS TO US lodged a claim of foul against the rider of STORMY BLUE for alleged interference in the run to the first turn. After review the claim of foul was upheld, and STORMY BLUE was disqualified from second and placed fourth.

ENTRY.NAME: Eddie Who
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped/steadied 5/8, tracked, rallied 3w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Ears to Us
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked 5/8, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked kick

ENTRY.NAME: Prince Cairo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, trailed, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Stormy Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, outfinished late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 83. Waiver Claiming Purse 15000. (PLUS UP TO $5,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 30 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG UNION away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of BLACK METAL entering the first turn, continued to force the issue from the outside of that foe in the run down the backside and through the final turn, got the better of that rival entering the lane, and drew clear as much the best. HE'S RELENTLESS settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and closed willingly two out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. SMART LAD away well and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to hold on for a share. STAR ENTRY unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, saved ground throughout, and finished with late interest from along the rail in the drive. FORT LANGLEY settled off the early pace while racing five wide into the backstretch, continued four wide while trying to commence his bid, but needed more late while racing six wide in the drive. BLACK METAL broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of BIG UNION in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on that rival entering the lane, and weakened in the drive. PARKER POINT settled off the early pacesetters while saving ground at the rail entering the backside, continued to save ground into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Parker Point
ENTRY.OWNER: Musgrove Donald H and Johnson Lyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Lad
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Black Metal
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Big Union
ENTRY.OWNER: Dale Dennis Rycroft Kelly and Rycroft Cathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: He's Relentless
ENTRY.OWNER: Nite and Day Stable and Todd, Joanne
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Langley
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 5 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Star Entry
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed rail
